Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.2: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BOILER AVERAGE PH: Measures the relative acidity or alkalinity of the boiler water.Valid values 0-15.
Column Comment.5: AVERAGE BOILER STACK TEMPERATURE: Average Boiler Stack Temperatureover the tour or period.
Column Comment.7: PUMP PRESSURE: The average pressure of the pump during this period.
Column Comment.9: BOOKED TIME ELAPSED: Total time, usually in hours, of equipment operationduring this tour, usually rounded to nearest 15 minutes. This number should notexceed the total length of the tour in hours.
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.12: EQUIPMENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the occurence of theequipment in drilling operations.
Column Comment.13: EQUIPMENT REFERENCE NUMBER: the reference number assigned to theequipment, such as the pump number where there is reduced pumping pressureobserved during a period.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.15: INTAKE DENSITY: Density of the drilling fluid entering the solids control equipment.Usually in kg/m3.
Column Comment.17: OVERFLOW DENSITY: Density of the cleaned fluid exiting the solids controlequipment, to be returned to the active system. Usually in kg/m3.
Column Comment.19: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL shouldbe created.
Column Comment.20: PUMP LINER INSIDE DIAMETER: Inside diameter of pump liner - used to calculatedisplacement.
Column Comment.22: PUMP STROKES COUNT: Pump strokes per unit of time (usually strokes perminute) for the period while on the hole. Usually reported at tour s end.
Column Comment.24: REDUCED PUMP PRESSURE DEPTH: Depth at which reduced rate pump pressureis recorded.
Column Comment.26: REDUCED PUMP PRESSURE: Pump Pressure recorded at a reduced pumpingspeed.
Column Comment.28: REDUCED PUMP STROKE COUNT: Pump strokes (usually per minute) at reducedpumping speed.
Column Comment.30: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.31: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.32: TUBING OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number identifying, in sequence, each changein pipe size.
Column Comment.33: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.34: TUBING TYPE: This reference table describes the particular type of tubular or type.For example tubing, casing or liner. This is a general classification. A more specificdescription can be found in R_LINER_TYPE.
Column Comment.35: UNDERFLOW DENSITY: Density of the solids or slurry SITY Density (usually Kg/m3) removed from the drilling fluid.
Column Comment.37: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.38: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.39: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.40: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.41: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.42: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.43: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
